proofSignals.proofNotes: Bosch relies heavily on massive scale metrics (billions in sales, thousands of employees/researchers) and sustainability achievements (carbon neutrality) to establish trust.

coherencePreview.notes: The stated mission ('Invented for life', 'Sustainability') is perfectly mirrored in the content hierarchy (Research topics, Sustainability reports, Product lines).

inventory.evidenceText: Polestar 2... Volvo XC40... Jeep Grand Cherokee

proofSignals.proofNotes: Strong use of specific OEM names (Volvo, Audi, Jeep) and quantitative metrics (115 variants, 15 million units) builds high credibility.

coherencePreview.notes: Extremely high coherence. The stated mission of 'safer, greener, connected' is perfectly mirrored in the product pages (ADAS, High Voltage, Connectivity). The 'Software-Defined' narrative is consistent across all levels.

frictions: Technical density may overwhelm non-engineer buyers.
Multiple regional homepages (JA, DE, ES) captured suggest heavy localization which is good, but navigation back to EN sometimes relies on browser detection.
quickFixIdeas: Add more direct 'Talk to an Expert' CTAs on product pages instead of just 'Learn More'.
Highlight the 'Contact Sales' button more prominently in the header.

outsideInEntryTest.whoItsFor: Automotive OEMs and engineers looking for integrated vehicle architecture and software solutions.

topConfusions: Distinction between Aptiv and Wind River (Wind River mentioned as software enabler).
Specifics of how 'Smart Vehicle Architecture' is implemented without deep technical reading.
